hello can someone help me please
i have this message coming up after i tried to install linuxmint.iso from the desktop
E: Type sty is not known on line 52 in source list /etc/apt/sources.list
E: The list of sources could not be read.
Go to the repository dialogue to correct the problem.
E: _cache->open() failed, please report.
will you stop spamming the channel with your error messages please
if it's urgent, it's particularly important that you stick to the rules and don't alienate the people here.
all the more reason to listen carefully to the replies, especially IdleOne's
rsync comes to mind
rsync user@name.server.com: /local/dir --compare-dest=/local/dir/ ?
not sure what you're trying to do, but that doesn't look right
have a look on the web for rsync tutorials -- there are plenty.
trying to compare the files i copied locally from a remote server that's failing to make sure they copied properly...
I would use rsync to just copy them again. Rsync won't re-transfer files if they are already present in the destination.
ok thx
rsync -avHK user@source.host.com:/opt/backup/ /local/backup?
that's looking better. Try with the -n or --dry-run option before you launch it in earnest.
